title: Pirate Ship
opening: Fargus's ship sails along smoothly. At last, they spot a fog-enshrouded isle on the horizon. Eliwood's father is on the isle, as is the Dragon's Gate. As they draw closer to the isle, Eliwood no longer fears that his father might be one of the conspirators. As the moment of truth nears, Eliwood only prays that he is safe.

After speaking with the Ostian spy Leila, Eliwood realizes he must travel to Valor, the Dread Isle. They head straight to the port city of Badon seeking passage. After a long journey, they spot a fog-enshrouded isle on the horizon. Eliwood’s father is on the isle, as is the Dragon’s Gate. As they draw closer to the isle, Eliwood no longer fears that his father might be one of the conspirators. As the moment of truth nears, Eliwood only prays that he is safe.

Fargus's ship sails along smoothly. At last, they spot a fog-enshrouded isle on the horizon. According to Leila's information, the enemy is gathering there. Darin, the marquess of Laus, the Black Fang assassins, the mysterious Nergal, and his henchman, Ephidel. As the island draws closer, Hector hears death whispering on the wind.

intro.speaker: Fargus
intro.line: Ahoy, laddie! You don't get seasick, do you?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: I'm fine, sir. This is a beautiful ship.

intro.speaker: Fargus
intro.line: Gwaa ha ha! For a sea rover, eh?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: May I ask you a question?

intro.speaker: Fargus
intro.line: What is it?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Why did you agree to give us passage? When we said that we wished to travel to Valor, the people in the harbor treated us as though we were mad.

intro.speaker: Fargus
intro.line: I'm sure they did. It is the Dread Isle, after all. If not for good reason, we wouldn't want to go either.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: And yet... you've given us free passage. Why is that?

intro.speaker: Fargus
intro.line: Listen to me, laddie. Man are strange beasts. We can't resist a challenge. Something appears on the horizon, and we immediately set sail. Some dreams we conquer, others we abandon... I've grown old. I haven't had a good challenge in many a year. Then you mooncalves appear seeking passage to the Dread Isle. I was impressed with your courage. I think you may be the ones to survive the Dread Isle.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: We won't disappoint you. We will return.

intro.speaker: Fargus
intro.line: All right. Then we'll weigh anchor and wait for you. Light a signal fire when you want to return, and we'll pick you up.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Thank you.

intro.speaker: Dart
intro.line: Captain! There's a dory adrift to port! It looks like there's someone aboard. What're your orders?

intro.speaker: Fargus
intro.line: Bring 'em aboard..... Looks like we've got a visitor. Odd though, finding a boat adrift near here...

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Odd? Why is that?

intro.speaker: Fargus
intro.line: The sea currents in this area... Anything drifting around here must've come from the Dread Isle.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Oh...

intro.speaker: Fargus
intro.line: Shall we greet our guest?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Eliwood! ...Huh?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: If you're looking for Eliwood, he's talking with the captain.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Oh. I won't bother him then.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: ....... ...Do you need something?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: I'd like you to stop pouting. This pirate ship is the only way for us to get to the Dread Isle. I thought you understood that. Was I mistaken?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: How I feel or what I think is no concern of yours!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Eliwood told me...about your parents and those bandits. But these pirates? They don't seem like bad fellows.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: It wasn't just my parents! My entire tribe! Everyone was killed! They poisoned our drinking water... My people were in such pain, they could hardly stand... That's when the bandits attacked! They waited until we were defenseless!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: My father put me on his horse, and I escaped... Just me. My poor father... The pain must have been terrible. He lifted me up...his arms shaking... ...with his last breath... Now do you understand? I was found unconscious by another tribe...and I awoke ten days later. When I awoke... What I felt... The bodies of my people had already been buried. I never even had the chance to say farewell. My last memory of my father... He was...broken...dying. I can still see the axes rising and falling. It... It's not........

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Hey!! What are you doing?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: You're a strong woman, Lyndis. I thought you would not want anyone to see you cry.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: You're such a fool! If you think that's what I want, then why not just leave!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: I... I lost my parents, too.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: You...

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: It was illness that took them. Nothing like what happened to you. Still, I wanted nothing more than to cry like a little baby. And yet, I couldn't cry... Not in front of others. And when I was alone, I found I still couldn't. So...I simply thought...I don't know...

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: You really are a fool. That's no way to... You can't just... ... .... ...

intro.speaker: Pirate
intro.line: Ahoy! There's a small dory adrift to port!! Someone's on board! Tell the captain!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: A boat? What's going on?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Let's go see!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Eliwood! You done talking to old man Fargus?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: You saw us?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: No, I heard you'd gone off with him. You learn anything?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: ...We can trust him. We got lucky, finding him.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Hmmm. If you say so.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Hey, you two! Come here! They've pulled the dory aboard! I wonder who's on board. It's... It's a girl!?
...Uh...uhnn...

intro.speaker: Dart
intro.line: Oy! You there!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Me?

intro.speaker: Dart
intro.line: Give me a hand, will you? I don't know where to... grab her.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Such the gentleman.

intro.speaker: Dart
intro.line: Stow it!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Hm? Ninian!? Ninian! Wake up!!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Unbelievable... What are the chances?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Do you know her?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: She's how Lyndis and I met a year back. I rescued Ninian from a band of villains.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Please, Ninian! Open your eyes!!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Ninian, can you hear me?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Are you well? Why were you on that boat? Where is Nils? Why wasn't he with you?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Ninian?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Lyndis, something's wrong with her.

intro.speaker: Ninian
intro.line: Who...Who..

intro.speaker: Dart
intro.line: Captain! Pirate ships approaching from the northwest!

intro.speaker: Fargus
intro.line: Do they dare attack Captain Fargus and the Davros? They must be mad!

intro.speaker: Dart
intro.line: What flag are they flying? I've never seen that pattern before.

intro.speaker: Fargus
intro.line: These seas belong to us! Whoever they are, they're in our waters! This is a day for strange occurrences, it seems. You whelps watch your own hides. We've no time to waste on you!
Uwaaaaaaa!! Water!!! The hull's been breached! We're taking on water!!!

intro.speaker: Fargus
intro.line: Breached? Those scum are more dangerous than I'd thought!

intro.speaker: Dart
intro.line: It's bad, Captain! We need all hands belowdecks, or we'll sink!!!

intro.speaker: Fargus
intro.line: Take care of it! I'm going to carve these scallywags some new gizzards!
We need your help! The water's up to the galley! You must come below, Captain!

intro.speaker: Fargus
intro.line: Grrr...

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Fargus! Leave the enemy to us!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Fighting is something we're good at! But a sinking ship? That's your affair! You have to do something, or we'll all drown!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: We'll deal with things up here. Please! Hurry!

intro.speaker: Fargus
intro.line: Fine!! The deck is yours! I'll be back as soon as we've plugged the breach in the hull!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Go! Lyn! Take her to that room!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: I will.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Here they come!

intro.speaker: Zoldam
intro.line: All we want is the girl. Kill the rest.

battle.speaker: Jake
battle.line: Ahoooy! Can you hold the deck until reinforcements arrive? Who? Me? I’m Jake. Hm? Aye, I’m new to the Davros’s crew. Huh? You heard about me from Anna? Oh… So she’s worried about me? That warms my heart, my friend! Let me give you some information. We’ve got merchants aboard. Buy what you need from them. This is the armory. This is the shop. You won’t be able to stock up once we reach the Dread Isle. Buy as much as you can carry while you’ve got the chance!

battle.speaker: Dart
battle.line: Ahoy! We’ll leave the fighting to you. Hold on until we can help! Oh, and we’ve merchants aboard. This is the armory. This is the shop. You won’t be able to stock up once we reach the Dread Isle. I suggest you buy as much as possible while you’ve the chance!

battle.speaker: Guy
battle.line: Ohhh... I'm going to be sick. Doesn't this bother you, Mark? This ship moves too much... I... I can still fight, though. My sword arm's fine!

battle.speaker: Priscilla
battle.line: Mark? What is it? No, I'm fine. I'm not seasick at all. Thank you for your concern.

battle.speaker: Zoldam
battle.line: Move ’round to the enemy ship’s stern. That’s where they should be waiting… That’s where they’ll die.

boss.speaker: Zoldam
boss.line: Don’t worry about any ambush. Board their ship. You don’t know how to fight? Go now, or die here...

boss.speaker: Zoldam
boss.line: You possess...this much...power...? Must warn... Must –

end.speaker: Fargus
end.line: Ahoy! I’m back! Now, who wants to die first? What’s this? You’ve routed ’em already? Nicely done, whelps!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Those sea dogs were no match for us!!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Ah! Ninian! You can’t come out yet! There’s blood everywhere!

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: …Blood?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Look out!

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: …Ah! I’m sorry.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Are you OK? Ninian?

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: Ninian? Is that…me? Is that…my name?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Ninian! What’s happened to you…

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: …I… My head…is so foggy. Am I…at sea?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Yes. We found you adrift in a small boat.

end.speaker: Fargus
end.line: Those scum were after the girl, it seems. Will you take her with you? The men are afraid she, well, she might be cursed, you know?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Cursed…?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Are you suggesting we leave Ninian behind?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: We can’t take her with us, can we? We’re heading for the Dread Isle. It’s dread for a reason, you know!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Regardless…she goes with us!

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Lyndis?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: When I saw her, I remembered something. The last time I saw Ninian… She and her brother were being hunted by some dark-robed men.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Dark-robed? Are you sure?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Yes, I think it must be the Black Fang. It didn’t occur to me before, but now I’m certain.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: How can you be sure?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: I can’t explain… There’s something in the air that hints at their involvement.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: If it’s true, then she’s likely to be attacked again.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Almost certainly. We can’t leave her behind. I will watch over her. Please…

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: I understand. We should be by her side to protect her.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Thank you.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: We’re all going to that island. Will you come with us?

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: Yes… Please…take me with you.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: “Something in the air”… Are you some sort of hound?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Ah! Are you mocking me?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: No, the opposite. I’m in utter admiration. …Say, Eliwood. When I left Ostia, I was attacked by a dark-robed group.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: What? Why didn’t you tell me this before?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Many people hold a grudge against Ostia. I didn’t think it had anything to do with this. Until now…

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Hector, do you think…

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: They were all wearing very distinct black robes. I don’t know about “something in the air,” but… I’m convinced they were related.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: What in the world is happening in Lycia? …Father……

end.speaker: Fargus
end.line: We’ve arrived.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Thank you very much.

end.speaker: Fargus
end.line: We’ll wait two weeks. Finish up by then.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: That’s more than enough time!

end.speaker: Fargus
end.line: And I’ve got a half-wit sailor who wants to go sightseeing. C’mere, Dart!

end.speaker: Dart
end.line: I’m here, Captain! Ready to serve!

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: We’re pleased to have you.

end.speaker: Fargus
end.line: His only redeeming feature is his sturdiness. Maybe he’ll come in handy.

end.speaker: Dart
end.line: Come on, Captain! I’m better’n that!

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: You’ve done so much… I can’t thank you enough…

end.speaker: Fargus
end.line: Come back alive! That’s all the thanks I need.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: All right. Farewell!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: We’ll be back before you know it!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: …There are good people, even among pirates.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: I don’t think the old man and his group are your average pirates.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Somewhere within that forest is the Dragon’s Gate.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Eliwood! No matter what it takes, we’re coming back with your father!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: …We’ll surely find him. We’ll all do our best to make it so.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: You’re right. Let’s make preparations to enter the forest.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Oh!

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: Dragon’s Gate…

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Ninian? What is it?

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: It’s…nothing……
